intro: Hypoestes sokotrana, commonly known as the Sokotra violet, is a flowering plant native to the Socotra archipelago. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has succulent leaves that are often hairy and can vary in shape, adapting to the arid environment of its native habitat. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for dry climates. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
